result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher David Doe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*12/6/2021  Honorable Danielle L. Shelton signed Order.  Restitution set at zero.*
*12/3/2020  Honorable Joseph Wall signed ORDER:  Restitution as to count two, David D.   set at zero.*
  Count one:  Set at $5,712.26 payable to Associated Bank.
Count two:  Set at $18,374.00 payable to David D.

Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court waives Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid.
DNA surcharge AND restitution to be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with David D., Rebecca L. and Robert L.
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed prescription.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or psosess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Christopher David Doe in court with attorney Katherine Graber for David Conley.  Defendant Christopher David Doe in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for Gracer Gall for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Christopher David Doe in court with Attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Christopher David Doe in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctor's report.  Parties do not contest report filed on 12-14-2021.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame with credit to be determined.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher David Doe in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Christopher David Doe in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement by:   Rebecca L. and Christopher D.   

AS TO COUNT  1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, with credit for 174 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $5,712.26 payable to Associated Bank.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment  
-No contact with David D., Rebecca L., and Robert L. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed prescription 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $18,374.00 payable to David D.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment 
-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments  as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment  
-No contact with David D., Rebecca L., and Robert L. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed prescription 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment
Filed, Pretrial Credit Sheet

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Christopher David Doe not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Yasin appears as new counsel.  Motion to withdraw plea is to be filed by 2/1/2016.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher David Doe in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Christopher David Doe in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant motion for new counsel heard and granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher David Doe in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Christopher David Doe in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to both counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral no contact order for David Doe.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers with SCRAM.    Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.

Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher David Doe in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Christopher David Doe in custody.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
